Guidance Note on Special Trade Transactions & Customs Representation

Second-Hand Goods Import - 
General Rule: Import allowed subject to conditions under FTP.
Conditions:
Electronics, machinery often need DGFT license.
Used capital goods sometimes allowed with Chartered Engineer’s Certificate.
Life-saving equipment, certain medical devices may be exempt.

✅Do’s & Don’ts Summary:
Do’s - 
Verify product eligibility under FTP.
Keep all customs documents handy (5-year record).
Ensure timely filing of appeals in case of disputes.
Use digital tools like ICEGATE for status tracking.
Don’ts - 
Don’t undervalue goods or misdeclare HSN.
Don’t import second-hand machinery without clearance.
Don’t ignore customs notices (can lead to penalties).
Don’t assume baggage rules cover commercial goods.





Documentation, Fee Structure & Timelines:
Second-Hand Goods Import - 
Documents:
IEC
Import License (from DGFT if required)
Chartered Engineer Certificate (valuation & usability)
Invoice, Packing List, BL, Insurance
Fee:
DGFT application fee (₹2,000–₹5,000).
Testing & inspection fees (case-specific).
Timeline:
License approval: 30–60 days.
Clearance: 3–5 days after license.
